intro: Billotia elliptica, commonly known as the narrow-leafed billotia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elliptical leaves and small, white or pinkish flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils. Billotia elliptica is often found in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia.
